benefits.title: l-Arginine Supplementation in Peripheral Arterial Disease: No Benefit and Possible Harm
benefits.summary: Long-term administration of l-arginine does not increase nitric oxide synthesis or improve vascular reactivity in patients with peripheral arterial disease.

benefits.title: l-Arginine Supplementation and Metabolism in Asthma
benefits.summary: L-arginine supplementation in asthma patients showed no difference in the number of exacerbations, exhaled nitric oxide levels, or lung function compared to the placebo group.

benefits.title: Therapeutic Benefits of l-Arginine: An Umbrella Review of Meta-analyses.
benefits.summary: L-arginine supplementation may reduce systolic and diastolic blood pressure in hypertensive adults, hospital-acquired infections, and hospital length of stay for surgical patients.

benefits.title: l-Arginine treatment improves angiogenic response and reduces matrix metalloproteinase activity in chronic heart failure patients with coronary artery disease
benefits.summary: L-arginine treatment improves angiogenic response and reduces matrix metalloproteinase activity in chronic heart failure patients with coronary artery disease.

benefits.title: Arginine regulation by myeloid derived suppressor cells and tolerance in cancer: mechanisms and therapeutic perspectives
benefits.summary: Increased metabolism of L-arginine by myeloid derived suppressor cells (MDSCs) producing arginase I inhibits T-lymphocyte responses, potentially reducing the therapeutic benefit of cancer vaccines and immunotherapy.

benefits.title: Anti-aging effects of l-arginine
benefits.summary: L-arginine intake has multiple beneficial pharmacological effects, including reduction in the risk of vascular and heart diseases, erectile dysfunction, improvement in immune response, and inhibition of gastric hyperacidity.

benefits.title: Role of L-arginine in the pathogenesis and treatment of renal disease.
benefits.summary: L-arginine supplementation has beneficial effects in several models of chronic kidney disease and may be beneficial in attenuating symptoms of preeclampsia.

benefits.title: Platelet nitric oxide synthesis in uremia and malnutrition: a role for L-arginine supplementation in vascular protection?
benefits.summary: L-arginine supplementation may help in vascular protection by inhibiting platelet aggregation and adhesion, potentially benefiting platelet function in malnourished uremic patients.

benefits.title: Therapeutic modification of the L-arginine-eNOS pathway in cardiovascular diseases.
benefits.summary: L-arginine therapy can improve endothelial function, vasoreactivity, and interaction between vascular wall, platelets, and leucocytes, potentially benefiting individuals with risk factors for atherosclerosis and coronary artery disease.

benefits.title: Administration of L-arginine plus L-citrulline or L-citrulline alone successfully retarded endothelial senescence
benefits.summary: L-citrulline and L-arginine supplementation retarded endothelial senescence and improved cardiovascular function.

side effects.title: Effects of L-Arginine Supplementation on Leukogram, Inflammatory Bowel Infiltrates and Immunoglobulins with 5-FU Use in Rats
side effects.summary: L-arginine supplementation attenuates side effects of 5-FU, including thrombocytopenia and neutropenia, and modulates IgA production.

side effects.title: Analgesic effect of L-arginine in patients with persistent pain
side effects.summary: L-arginine side effects include a slight decrease in mean blood pressure (10-15 mm Hg) and dryness of the mouth.

side effects.title: Adverse gastrointestinal effects of arginine and related amino acids.
side effects.summary: Large single doses of L-arginine may cause diarrhea, but adverse effects disappear if divided doses are ingested.

side effects.title: The dark side of an essential amino acid - L-arginine in spinal cord injury.
side effects.summary: L-arginine potentiates neuroinflammation and nitric oxide production, leading to secondary damage, and modulating its metabolism after spinal cord injury is challenging due to its conflicting roles.

side effects.title: Effects of L-arginine pretreatment on nitric oxide metabolism and hepatosplanchnic perfusion during porcine endotoxemia.
side effects.summary: L-arginine pretreatment improves hepatosplanchnic perfusion and oxygenation during prolonged endotoxemia without causing deleterious systemic side effects.
side effects.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

side effects.title: l-Arginine Improves Diminished Cerebral CO2 Reactivity in Patients
side effects.summary: L-arginine improves impaired CO2 reactivity of the cerebral vessels in patients with impaired vasomotor reactivity.
side effects.journal: Stroke: Journal of the American Heart Association

side effects.title: L-Arginine as a Potential Ergogenic Aidin Healthy Subjects
side effects.summary: Low oral doses (20 g) of L-arginine are well tolerated and clinical side effects are rare in healthy subjects.

side effects.title: L-Arginine Pretreatment Reduces Intestinal Mucositis as Induced by 5-FU in Mice
side effects.summary: L-arginine can positively impact intestinal mucositis by promoting partial mucosal recovery, reducing inflammation, and improving intestinal permeability.

side effects.title: Influência do Tratamento Crônico com L-arginina na Função Renal de Ratos Submetidos a um Modelo Experimental de Doença Renal Crônica/ Influence of Chronic Treatment with L-arginine on Renal Function in Rats Subjected to an Experimental Model of Chronic Ki
side effects.summary: L-arginine supplementation has no effect on renal failure and does not produce improvements in urea, creatinine, total protein, and urinary debit.

side effects.title: The effect of oral administration of L–arginine on anal resting pressure and anodermal blood flow in healthy volunteers
side effects.summary: Oral administration of 15g L-arginine daily increased arginine plasma levels but had no influence on anodermal blood flow and anal resting pressure.

dosage.title: Transient improvement of acetylcholine responses after short-term oral L-arginine in forearms of human heart failure.
dosage.summary: A single 20-g oral dose of L-arginine increased plasma levels by fourfold in patients with heart failure.

dosage.title: Improvement of cardiac output and liver blood flow and reduction of pulmonary vascular resistance by intravenous infusion of L-arginine during the early reperfusion period in pig liver transplantation.
dosage.summary: L-arginine infusion at a dosage of 500 mg/kg body weight improved cardiac performance, oxygen consumption, and reduced pulmonary vascular resistance in pig liver transplantation.

dosage.title: L-arginine reduces glomerular basement membrane collagen N epsilon-carboxymethyllysine in the diabetic db/db mouse.
dosage.summary: L-arginine dosage in this study was 50 mg/kg body weight orally.

dosage.title: Effects of arginine and ornithine on strength, lean body mass and urinary hydroxyproline in adult males.
dosage.summary: Dosages of L-arginine in this study were 2 grams or 1 gram each, taken orally for a total of 25 administrations.
dosage.journal: The Journal of sports medicine and physical fitness

dosage.title: Effect of L-Arginine supplementation on blood lactate level and VO2 max at anaerobic threshold performance
dosage.summary: L-arginine supplementation (5 g/day) decreases blood lactate level and may have beneficial effects on muscular fatigue, but does not significantly increase VO2 max at anaerobic threshold.

dosage.title: Dosage of L-arginine Preventing Acute High-dose PDD Nephrotoxicity
dosage.summary: The optimal dose of L-arginine to prevent acute high-dose PDD nephrotoxicity is 10 g/(m2d).
dosage.journal: The Chinese-german Journal of Clinical Oncology

dosage.title: Combination of the therapy of the anticoagulants and Tivortin in patients with cardiac ishemia at COVID-19
dosage.summary: The daily average requirement of L-arginine is 4.2 mg.

dosage.title: Studies on the metabolism of amino acids and related compounds in vivo. VII. Influence of the route of administration of L-arginine. HCI on protecting rats against ammonia toxicity.
dosage.summary: L-arginine hydrochloride at the lowest dosage levels, intraperitoneal and intrasplenic, provides almost complete protection against ammonia toxicity in rats.

dosage.title: L-arginine decreases infarct size caused by middle cerebral arterial occlusion in SHR.
dosage.summary: L-arginine (300 mg/kg ip) decreased infarct size in rats subjected to distal middle cerebral arterial plus ipsilateral common carotid arterial occlusion by 31%.
